abstract: The former director, H. Clayton Peterson, was sentenced to two years probation with three months home confinement, instead of 12 to 18 months in prison under federal guidelines.
snippet: The former director, H. Clayton Peterson, was sentenced to two years probation with three months home confinement, instead of 12 to 18 months in prison under federal guidelines.
lead_paragraph: A former director of a publicly traded energy company was sentenced on Tuesday but avoided prison after pleading guilty to tipping off his son that the energy company was a takeover target.

headline.main: Ex-Mariner Director Avoids Prison in Insider Case
